content.title: Our Approach
content.body:
We love tending smaller gardens in which plants play the starring role. 
Whether working with an existing border or starting from scratch, we love making planting schemes look as good as they can throughout the year.
With a wide plant knowledge and understanding of planting design principles, we can work with you to create plant communities which look right together, and are happy in the specific conditions of your garden.
Our primary goal is to ensure your plants are as healthy and vigorous as possible. This is achieved through carefully matching plants to their environment and improving the soil with organic matter.  
Thriving plants not only look better for longer, they are also naturally resistant to pests, disease and the varied challenges of extreme and unpredictable weather.
We specialise in tending gardens with a natural feel - ranging from light-touch maintenance for 'wild' gardens to more designed planting schemes which mimic natural ecosystems - woodland, prairie, bog or gravel gardens.

content.title: In a nutshell...
content.body:
We love tending and designing smaller gardens in which plants play the starring role.

We specialise in giving gardens a natural feel - ranging from 'wild' gardens to more carefully crafted schemes inspired by natural habitats - woodland, prairie, bog or gravel gardens.

Drawing on a wide plant knowledge and applying design principles, we strive to create plant communities which look great together and are happy in the specific conditions of your garden, while also providing food and habitat for wildlife.

We operate in Kendal and nearby villages.

content.title: Organic garden maintenance
content.body:
We offer a maintenance service informed by both practical horticultural knowledge (RHS qualified) and garden design principles (qualified to Level 3).

We provide a wide range of maintenance services for the smaller garden, with a focus on:

- Herbaceous border planning and maintenance
- Naturalistic, wildlife-friendly planting schemes
- Small vegetable plot management
- Soil care and preparation
- Plant and bulb selection advice
- Shrub and small tree pruning
- Plant propagation
- Small pond installation and planting
- Wildflower lawns

For regular maintenance we charge a Â£25 hourly rate.

cards.title: Feed your soil
cards.body: A thriving garden begins with understanding your soil and its needs. We often recommend adding large amounts of organic matter, such as mushroom compost, in the early spring. This adds nutrients, suppresses weeds and helps soil retain moisture through the season.

cards.title: Right plant, right place
cards.body: From damp, shady spots to dry, sunny banks it is vital to choose plants which will thrive in the specific growing conditions of your garden. Healthy, vigorous plants are naturally more pest and drought-resistent and can often be divided to produce more plants for free!

cards.title: Work with nature
cards.body: Encouraging birds, hedgehogs and frogs can help control the slug population. Selectively welcoming self-seeded plants such as Welsh poppies and foxgloves adds spontaneity to a border. We believe working with nature can be   more effective than battling for control.
